title: Fact Check: Don’t fall for this FAKE picture of PM Modi | Newsmobile
author: newsmobile.in
vclaim:
After the first lockdown, scores of migrant labourers were seen walking on the roads and travelling to their hometowns, a picture is being widely shared on social media, in which a woman can be seen pushing a cart with Prime Minister Narendra Modi sitting on it.

The caption read along with this image is: “ #देश ढो_रहा_है, अपने बच्चों सहित अपने #प्रधानमंत्री_जी को 🤔”

ALSO READ: Fact check: Did the Sattar Ghat bridge in Bihar collapse after…

NewsMobile fact-checked the above picture found to be FAKE.

On putting the picture through Reverse Image Search, we found the same picture in which a woman was travelling to hometown with her family.

The description under the image is, “Migrant labourers walk on a road as they wait for transportation to go back to their hometowns in Allahabad on May 24. | Sanjay Kanojia/AFP“

In the above FAKE vs REAL collage, it is clear that PM Narendra Modi’s image was edited and placed along with women travelling to her hometown.

On digging further, we ran a search using keywords ‘PM Modi’ ‘sitting’ ‘Yoga Day’ on Google Search and found the real picture in an article on rte.ie dated June 21, 2015, in which PM Narendra Modi was performing Yoga on International Yoga Day.

Therefore we can conclude that PM Narendra Modi’s original picture was manipulated.

Hence, the post on social media is fake. The picture of PM Modi and migrant labour is not connected to each other which proves that the viral picture is FAKE.
